item.title: By: Samaniego7766

item.description: Quite a good read, I always enjoy informational pieces. I hope to see more like it soon!

item.description: Thanks for the great post, Naomi, and also for submitting this to T-SQL Tuesday!

item.title: By: Roselee Novencido
item.dc:creator: Roselee Novencido
item.description: This domain appears to get a good ammount of visitors. How do you advertise it? It gives a nice individual twist on things. I guess having something real or substantial to give info on is the most important thing.
item.content:encoded: This domain appears to get a good ammount of visitors. How do you advertise it? It gives a nice individual twist on things. I guess having something real or substantial to give info on is the most important thing.

item.title: By: Jeremy
item.dc:creator: Jeremy
item.description: Great post full of useful tips! My site is fairly new and I am also having a hard time getting my readers to leave comments. Analytics shows they are coming to the site but I have a feeling nobody wants to be first.
item.content:encoded: Great post full of useful tips! My site is fairly new and I am also having a hard time getting my readers to leave comments. Analytics shows they are coming to the site but I have a feeling nobody wants to be first.

item.title: By: Elizabeth Beehler
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Beehler
item.description: Most of the times i visit a blog I notice that most blogs are amateurish.On the other hand,I could honestly say that you writting is decent and your website solid.
item.content:encoded: Most of the times i visit a blog I notice that most blogs are amateurish.On the other hand,I could honestly say that you writting is decent and your website solid.

item.title: By: Berneice Celentano

item.description: Most what i read online is trash and copy paste but i think you offer something different. Bravo.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Yes, I agree, that in many cases the processing can be also done on the client. I guess in every case it depends on many different factors what would be preferable.
item.content:encoded: Yes, I agree, that in many cases the processing can be also done on the client. I guess in every case it depends on many different factors what would be preferable.

item.title: By: Web Design
item.dc:creator: Web Design
item.description: I wonder if CTE's (like the CTE used in solving the pallet problem) would become more readable and understandable if the logic moved to code other than SQL. SQL is not well suited to be a programming language.
item.content:encoded: I wonder if CTE’s (like the CTE used in solving the pallet problem) would become more readable and understandable if the logic moved to code other than SQL. SQL is not well suited to be a programming language.
